alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 7:53PM CDT until May 08 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Current River near Powder Mill affecting Shannon County. James River at Galena affecting Stone County. James River NEAR Boaz affecting Stone and Christian Counties. For the James River Basin...including Boaz, Galena...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Current River...including Powder Mill...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Galena. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Approximate level which floods Hootentown Access and Campground. At 17.5 feet, Flood waters reach the second window level of the restrooms at the James River Outfitter Canoe Park area. (938.5 FT MSL) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 9.1 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 800 PM CDT.
